page.title: 13Maldon and Shopping
page.content: Many people in Maldon and the surrounding villages do their main weekly shopping in the town itself. With its narrow, winding High Street and the many small shops strung out along its length it is in many ways a very pleasant old market town in which to shop.But many people had criticisms of Maldon as a place to do shopping. 1) There are few car parks and the charges some felt are exhorbitant. 2){Maldon Hill}acts as a deterrent to those approaching the town from the direction of Heybridge. 3) There are no large shops or supermarkets and some felt that better bargains could be had in Chelmsford or Colchester. 4) Maldon is a small town which can quickly become packed with people. 5) Its narrow and winding streets make it dangerous for pedestrians.
